verses.roman:
eta bali' tāre 'nāma' upadeśa kari'
uṭhiyā calilā ṭhākura bali' 'hari' 'hari'

synonyms: eta bali'-saying this; tāre—her; nāma upadeśa kari'-instructing about the process of chanting the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra; uṭhiyā—standing up; calilā—left; ṭhākura—Haridāsa Ṭhākura; bali'-chanting; hari hari—the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra.
translation: After thus instructing the prostitute about the process of chanting the Hare Kṛṣṇa mantra, Haridāsa Ṭhākura stood up and left, continuously chanting "Hari, Hari."
